title: Warning saying account disconnected now on the open Application Button
content:
I just noticed this as of a few minutes ago, & I'm not sure why it's there. I saw it as I was doing some research, & I didn't get kicked off line, or anything like that. I saved my links, & shut down Firefox, & then restarted it, with no problem. And I had no problem getting to this forum. Over the several years of using Firefox, I've never seen this before.

When I clicked on the warning icon, it took me to Mozilla Accounts, & then wanted me to download a recovery key???

The page disappeared, & then wanted me to sign back in, & then it refused my password three times! It reappeared, & then wanted me to "Synch", my phone, & PC, which I'm not going to do.

So,... What was/is this latest issue with Firefox about?

title: menu bar keeps flashing - disrupts whatever I'm doing (typing etc)
content:
The menu bar keeps flashing about every 5-10 seconds. When it does it disrupts / interrupts whatever I'm typing, deleting everything I've typed when the flash occurs.

It also disrupts things like using a drop down menu. The menu is opened (aka dropped down) but when the flash occurs it collapses the drop down menu.

Also for example en typing; let's say I'm typing " Mary had a little lamb". After typing "Mary had a" the Menu bar flashes. When it does "Mary had a" gets deleted. As I continue to type not knowing "Mary had a" was deleted I look up and see all that's left is "little lamb".

It's constantly doing this even while typing this message / question.

If copy and pasting it'll clear the text I've chosen to copy so I have to go back and re-select it. And try to get it done quickly before the next flash occurs. But if the next flash occurs the same thing happens all over again.

I have no idea what's going on. Searched and searched and can't find anything. It's making Firefox almost impossible to use. Please help me?!

I'm using Firefox version 115.18.0esr It is up to date.
creator: george198

title: Performace issues with YouTube.
content:
Hello.

For the past few months, I've been experiencing severe issues with performance that I noted appear only on YouTube. I have not noticed this on any other website. The site is unresponsive, takes a long time to load, key presses (pause, skip 10s, etc.) are registered with a massive delay. It is generally very unpleasant to use.

I have tried disabling all extensions, clearing data, I even reinstalled the entire operating system once for a different reason and the issue still persisted. I launched YouTube on different browsers (Chrome) with no performance issues at all.

I lived with this problem for a long time now, but recently it's becoming unbearable. I prefer Firefox to Chromium-based browsers, but as YouTube is a site I visit very frequently, I will unfortunately consider switching to another browser.

I have not found any useful resources regarding this issue on the Internet, it seems like it's not a common problem.

Any help is appreciated.

title: Firefox 133 can't load websites, other browsers can
content:
After a recent update to Firefox 133.0.3 (on Ubuntu GNU/Linux 22.04), Firefox is having difficulty connecting to websites and exhibiting some other odd behavior:

- After initially starting Firefox, it will load websites (e.g., previously open tabs) for up to 30 seconds. After that, it will not load any website in a new tab, showing the loading animation for several seconds before stopping all activity and just displaying an hourglass icon in the tab. These sites can be connected to in other web browsers. - After closing Firefox, its process is still running; I have to manually find its pid and kill it. - If I start Firefox from the terminal, I see these messages when it starts having trouble loading websites:

libva info: VA-API version 1.20.0 libva info: Trying to open /snap/firefox/5437/gnome-platform/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/dri/iHD_drv_video.so libva info: Found init function __vaDriverInit_1_20 libva info: va_openDriver() returns 0

title: Issue with Website Functionality on Firefox
content:
Dear Mozilla Community/Support Team,

I am reaching out to report an issue with my <a href="https://chipotlmenu.com">Wesbite</a>, which is not functioning properly when accessed through Firefox.

The website operates flawlessly on other browsers such as Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Safari. However, on Firefox, I have noticed slow loading times, broken images and layout inconsistencies

This issue negatively impacts the user experience for visitors accessing the site through Firefox, which is a critical concern for me. I kindly request your guidance on diagnosing and resolving the problem. Please let me know if you need additional details or technical information to help investigate further.

Thank you for your time and assistance. I appreciate the dedication of the Mozilla team in supporting website compatibility and look forward to your response.

Best regards, Lily Floori Lilyfloori@gmail.com Owner, Chipotlmenu.com

title: Firefox.exe opens last session while private_browsing.exe is running
content:
This issue is about two executables in C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox:

  • firefox.exe, which starts Firefox, and
  • private_browsing.exe, which starts Firefox in Private Browsing mode.

If you start firefox.exe while private_browsing.exe is running, it restores the last session. I have been experiencing this issue for about a year.

Steps to reproduce:

  • Start firefox.exe.
  • Open x.com instead of your home page, and xe.com on a second tab.
  • Exit Firefox (Alt+F4).
  • Start private_browsing.exe.
  • Start firefox.exe.
  • Actual result: Three tabs are opened: x.com, xe.com, and your home page.
  • Expected result: only your home page is opened.

Can anybody confirm the bug? Will there be a fix for this?
creator: Jonnae

title: Firefox Update
content: Hi James Your reply does not answer my question - "Could you please advise a work-around to allow me to continue to use Firefox V 94.0.1 reliably after 25 March 2025". Thank you. Also FYI, I indicated that I was continuing to use Firefox V 94.0.1 (64-bit) on Windows 7 Professional.
